explosives.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_gases.rationale: The lower explosion limit is 6.2vol% (ICSC (1999)). Classified into Division 2.1 (UN#2517) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified into Division 2.1(UN#2517) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: The boiling point is -9degC (HSDB (2006)), and the critical temperature is 137.1degC (HSDB (2006)) - i.e., liquefied gas. Classified into Divisions 2.1 (UN#2517) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

organic_peroxides.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gaseous substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (EHC 139 (1992)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation exposure) value of 128,000ppm (SIDS (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its vapour is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its dust/mist is not expected.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (SIDS (2004)): "Slight conjunctival swelling with some discharge," suggesting that the substance is a mild eye irritant.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative result in multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests) and somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), and the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in SIDS (2004), EHC 139 (1992) and DFGOT vol. 1 (1990).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible given the insufficiency of data for use in classification, along with the absence of existing classification.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on genitals observed in two repeated dose toxicity studies (13-week inhalation study in one sex and 2-year inhalation study in both sexes), described in SIDS. A teratogenicity study in rats (inhalation) is also available that suggests delayed ossification of the occipital bones. However, the author concluded the effects were not attributable to the test substance.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The evidence of adverse effects on respiratory organs, nervous system and death are reported. However, the dosages of all tests (128,000ppm, 200,000ppm, 400,000ppm) exceed the guidance value.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Due to the fact that the lowest dosages of all tests (1,000ppm) exceed the guidance value.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a gas at ordinary temperatures.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=36mg/L of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (EHC139, 1992).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 3 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=1.66(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 3.
